It is located along the highways of U.S. Route 75, Minnesota State Highway 23 and Minnesota State Highway 30. The catlinite, or "pipestone", has been traditionally used to make ceremonial pipes, vitally important to traditional Plains Indian religious practices. The quarries at this location are considered sacred by various Native American tribes, including the Dakota, Lakota, and others. Historically, these quarries served as neutral territory where all Nations could gather to quarry stone for ceremonial pipes.

According to the 2011 census, the municipality is divided into several main places. The municipal council consists of 19 members elected by mixed-member proportional representation, with 10 councillors elected by first-past-the-post voting in 10 wards and the remaining 9 chosen from party lists to ensure proportional representation of votes received. In the August 2016 election, the African National Congress (ANC) won a majority of 12 seats on the council. The election results are as follows:

1. African National Congress (ANC): 12 seats
2. Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF): 3 seats
3. Democratic Alliance (DA): 2 seats
4. Freedom Front Plus (FF+): 1 seat
5. African Christian Democratic Party (ACDP): 1 seat

This summary provides a brief overview of the administrative area, its division into main places, and the political makeup of the Masilonyana Local Municipality.

summary_text:
Rand West City Local Municipality is a local government body in South Africa, formed by the merger of Randfontein and Westonaria municipalities after the August 2016 local elections. It falls under the West Rand District Municipality. The municipal council comprises 69 members, elected using mixed-member proportional representation. Thirty-five councillors are elected through first-past-the-post voting in 35 wards, while the remaining 34 are chosen from party lists to ensure proportional representation of votes. In the 2016 election, the African National Congress (ANC) secured a majority of seats on the council. The election results are as follows:

1. African National Congress (ANC): 43 seats
2. Democratic Alliance (DA): 12 seats
3. Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF): 10 seats
4. Freedom Front Plus (FF+): 2 seats
5. African Christian Democratic Party (ACDP): 1 seat
6. Congress of the People (COPE): 1 seat

This summary indicates that the ANC holds a significant majority in the Rand West City Local Municipality council following the 2016 elections.

summary_text: Lewis Elston Cardiff, born on January 22, 1889, in Brussels, Ontario, was a member of the House of Commons of Canada. passage_text: Sandégué Department is a department of Gontougo Region in Zanzan District, Ivory Coast. In 2014, its population was 56,215 and its seat is the settlement of Sandégué. The sub-prefectures of the department are Bandakagni-Tomora, Dimandougou, Sandégué, and Yorobodi. History. Sandégué Department was created in 2009 as a second-level subdivision via a split-off from Bondoukou Department. At its creation, it was part of Zanzan Region. In 2011, districts were introduced as new first-level subdivisions of Ivory Coast. At the same time, regions were reorganised and became second-level subdivisions and all departments were converted into third-level subdivisions. At this time, Sandégué Department became part of Gontougo Region in Zanzan District.
summary_text: Sandégué Department is a third-level administrative division located in the Gontougo Region of Zanzan District, Ivory Coast. Established in 2009 as a split-off from Bondoukou Department, it initially belonged to Zanzan Region. In 2011, districts were introduced as first-level subdivisions, and regions were reorganized to become second-level subdivisions, with all departments becoming third-level subdivisions. As a result, Sandégué Department became part of Gontougo Region in Zanzan District. Its population in 2014 was 56,215, and its seat is the settlement of Sandégué. The department is divided into four sub-prefectures: Bandakagni-Tomora, Dimandougou, Sandégué, and Yorobodi.

summary_text: Le5 Communications is a Canadian media company based in Sudbury, Ontario, that operates radio stations and newspapers in the Northeastern Ontario region. summary_text: George I. Cunningham was a Republican politician who served as the 44th mayor of Charleston, South Carolina from 1873 to 1877. passage_text: The Mountaineer was a newspaper published in Katoomba, New South Wales which circulated throughout the Blue Mountains and Hartley districts between 1894 and 1908. History. summary_text: "The Mountaineer" was a newspaper published in Katoomba, New South Wales, circulating throughout the Blue Mountains and Hartley districts from 1894 to 1908. The paper's circulation extended to the Blue Mountain and Hartley Districts. In late 1894, Moss sold the paper to Peter Giles Hart, who served as its publisher until May 1904. At this point, he passed the ownership to his brother-in-law, John Knight.

passage_text: Omar Mokhtar El-Hariri (– 2 November 2015) was a leading figure of the National Transitional Council of Libya who served as the Minister of Military Affairs in 2011, during the Libyan Civil War. He controlled the National Liberation Army and the Free Libyan Air Force from March to May 2011. He served on the council Executive Board before being replaced by Jalal al-Digheily, and he headed Military Affairs in the unicameral National Transitional Council legislature. El-Hariri was involved in the initial 1969 coup against the monarchy that began Muammar Gaddafi's 42-year rule of Libya. He organised a plot to overthrow Gaddafi in 1975. When the coup was uncovered, 300 men were arrested, four of whom died during interrogation.
summary_text: Omar Mokhtar El-Hariri was a significant figure in the National Transitional Council of Libya, serving as the Minister of Military Affairs during the Libyan Civil War in 2011. summary_text: The New Orleans Pelicans are a professional basketball team based in New Orleans, competing in the NBA's Western Conference Southwest Division. summary_text: The Elisha F. Stone House, built in 1854 in South Paris, Maine, is a significant Gothic Revival house and a notable historic landmark in Oxford County. The Stone House, which overlooks both Gothic Street and High Street, was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1983.

passage_text: Libidinal Economy () is a 1974 book by the French philosopher Jean-François Lyotard. The work has been compared to the philosopher Gilles Deleuze and the psychoanalyst Félix Guattari's "Anti-Oedipus" (1972). Critics have argued that the work lacks a moral or political orientation. Lyotard subsequently abandoned its views and developed an interest in postmodernism. Summary. Lyotard explores the psychoanalytic concept of the libido, and the relation of libido to the human body and human behavior. He also discusses the work of authors such as the philosophers Karl Marx and Friedrich Nietzsche, Sigmund Freud, the founder of psychoanalysis, and the linguist Ferdinand de Saussure.
summary_text: Jean-François Lyotard's 1974 book, "Libidinal Economy," delves into the psychoanalytic concept of the libido, its connection to the human body and behavior, and its implications in human society. The work shares similarities with Gilles Deleuze and Félix Guattari's "Anti-Oedipus" (1972). However, critics argue that the work lacks a clear moral or political orientation. Despite its initial focus, Lyotard later abandoned these views and developed an interest in postmodernism. In his exploration, Lyotard references the works of philosophers like Karl Marx and Friedrich Nietzsche, psychoanalyst Sigmund Freud, and linguist Ferdinand de Saussure.

passage_text: Mary Eddy Kidder (January 31, 1834 – June 25, 1910) was an American missionary and educator in Japan. In 1869, she became a missionary and travelled with Samuel Robbins Brown to Japan.
summary_text:
Mary Eddy Kidder, born on January 31, 1834, and passed away on June 25, 1910, was an American missionary and educator who made significant contributions in Japan. She was raised in a devoutly Christian family in Wardsboro, Vermont, and received her education there. Kidder later worked as a teacher at the Wardsboro Academy, which was run by the Dutch Reformed Church of America.

In 1869, Kidder embarked on a missionary journey to Japan, traveling with Samuel Robbins Brown. In Japan, she established Ferris Women's Seminary, which later became Ferris University, marking the first Christian women's college in the country. Kidder's work played a crucial role in the spread of Christianity and education for women in Japan.

passage_text: Grand Portage National Monument is a United States National Monument located on the north shore of Lake Superior in northeastern Minnesota that preserves a vital center of fur trade activity and Anishinaabeg Ojibwe heritage. The "Grand Portage" is an (2720 rod) footpath which bypasses a set of waterfalls and rapids on the last of the Pigeon River before it flows into Lake Superior. passage_text: The "Hindenburg" disaster was an airship accident that occurred on May 6, 1937, in Manchester Township, New Jersey, United States. The accident caused 35 fatalities (13 passengers and 22 crewmen) from the 97 people on board (36 passengers and 61 crewmen), and an additional fatality on the ground.
